hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}}$.

![rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 eighth. same sized rectangle below it, with 2 of 3 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 third](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/893d84de650466a3dccc5de75e5593a0ecc97f42)

$\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}} \neq \greenD{\dfrac{2}{3}}$

![rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 eighth. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 6 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 sixth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/45c9e24d8d7016a831f2f7c039f3049e0b06ff00)

$\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{3}{6}}$

![rectangle with 6 of 8 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 eighth. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 fourth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5877be1fc4f4e416e20e338b08d7d1ad35c63c23)

$\blueD{\dfrac{6}{8}} = \purpleD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

The following fraction is equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac68}$:

- $\purpleD{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac6{8}$?**
